event.title: is bordered on three sides by the city of Los Angeles – Pacific Palisades to the north, Brentwood on the northeast, Sawtelle on the east, Mar

data.event: Situated on Santa Monica Bay, it is bordered on three sides by the city of Los Angeles – Pacific Palisades to the north, Brentwood on the northeast, Sawtelle on the east, Mar Vista on the southeast, and Venice on the south.
The city has experienced a boom since the late 1980s through the revitalization of its downtown core, significant job growth and increased tourism.

event.title: camped near the present day intersection of Barrington and Ohio Avenues on August 3, 1769

data.event: The first non-indigenous group to set foot in the area was the party of explorer Gaspar de Portolà, who camped near the present day intersection of Barrington and Ohio Avenues on August 3, 1769.

event.title: was named in honor of the feast day of Saint Monica (mother of Saint Augustine), but her feast day is actually May 4

data.event: One says that it was named in honor of the feast day of Saint Monica (mother of Saint Augustine), but her feast day is actually May 4.
